intro: Trigonia killipii, commonly known as the Killip's trigonia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Trigonia killipii thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found growing in open, sunny areas along the coastline. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
